title: NBA conference finals takeaways: Pacers' miraculous OT Game 1 comeback over Knicks
content: Here's what has stood out from the latest playoff games of the Eastern and Western conference finals.

title: Longtime Colts owner and CEO Irsay dies at 65
content: Jim Irsay, who had led the Colts since 1997 and presided over one of the storied franchise's greatest eras, died Wednesday.

title: Haliburton's wild shot keys Pacers in G1 stunner
content: Tyrese Haliburton sent Game 1 to overtime with a dramatic buzzer-beater, and the Pacers pulled off their latest playoff comeback in a 138-135 win over the Knicks.

title: Knicks acknowledge they 'let off the gas' late
content: The Knicks led the Pacers by 14 points with under three minutes to play Wednesday night, but through an array of defensive mistakes and costly turnovers, they lost in overtime to open the Eastern Conference finals.

title: Stars use 3rd-period flurry to take G1 from Oilers
content: The Stars scored three straight power-play goals early in the third period and rode the momentum to a 6-3 win over the Oilers in their Western Conference final opener Wednesday night.

title: Thunder's SGA bests Jokic again to win first MVP
content: The Thunder's Shai Gilgeous-Alexander, who averaged 32.7 points to win the league's scoring title, has earned his first NBA MVP, finishing ahead of Nikola Jokic.

title: Wolves' Edwards fined for postgame profanity
content: The NBA fined Wolves star Anthony Edwards $50,000 for "using profane language" during a news conference following Minnesota's Game 1 loss to Oklahoma City.

title: Sources: Tempers flare in tense tush push debate
content: Debate over the tush push led to a heated exchange between NFL owners and league executives, sources told ESPN.

title: Sources: Pulisic won't play for U.S. at Gold Cup
content: AC Milan and United States attacker Christian Pulisic won't be part of the team that takes part in the Gold Cup, sources confirmed to ESPN.

title: 📷 NFL world celebrates failed tush push ban
content: From the Los Angeles Chargers to Lane Johnson, here's how the NFL world reacted to the failed tush push ban.

title: MLB Power Rankings: A brand-new team debuts at No. 1
content: Detroit continues its meteoric rise up our list ... all the way to the top spot in Week 8, bypassing two dominant NL teams.

title: Defense has turned Cardinals into contenders -- and set up a trade deadline dilemma
content: St. Louis might have baseball's best gloves. Will that mean the Cards hold on to their best arms this summer?

title: Are the NBA playoffs too physical? Have the refs actually lost control? Here's what the data says
content: The discourse -- and discord -- surrounding playoff officiating isn't new. But this year, players and coaches have wondered if the league has lost control. The NBA says its ref data is in line with past years. Who's right?

title: Inside the world of NBA 'ball boys,' the league's unsung heroes
content: Ball boys are everywhere on the court but are rarely seen or acknowledged. And yet, the NBA couldn't function without them.

title: 16 AFC teams, 16 offseason awards: Sizing up each front office's past few months with one superlative
content: The Bengals have an unhappy star. The Patriots have turned over their roster. And the Raiders are in line to take a huge step forward.

title: Which rookies will make biggest impact? Projecting first-year leaders in 10 stat areas
content: We predicted the NFL's top rookies in 10 different stats for 2025. Who will dominate box scores this fall?

title: Stop worrying and celebrate the tush push -- all the reasons it deserved to live
content: Some believe the play is unstoppable, and now it has proved unkillable -- even for the NFL and its owners.

title: Ange Postecoglou keeps his two-year promise with long-awaited trophy for Tottenham
content: Tottenham Hotspur ended a 17-year drought by winning the Europa League, as Manchester United go back to square one on a disappointing season.

title: Hurricanes-Panthers Game 2 preview: Key players, matchup notes, stats to know
content: Florida dominated Carolina in Game 1 to the tune of a 5-2 win. Will the outcome be different Thursday?

title: The secret routines fueling NBA players' grip on the game
content: Whether it's hand cream or powder, the on-court routines of NBA players have become a leaguewide obsession.

title: Flaming hot: Christian Pulisic models new AC Milan kit
content: AC Milan's new home kit sees the return of the historic "Diavoletto" symbol, which is integrated into the flame motifs running through the stripes.

title: Can Arsenal upset Barcelona?
content: Underdogs Arsenal face champions Barcelona in the 2025 UEFA Women's Champions League final, but who will come out on top?

title: Manny Pacquiao's boxing success relies on the things he has probably lost
content: Manny Pacquiao has won titles in eight divisions, but even for him, Father Time could be a tough opponent to beat.

title: Amorim: Won't seek payoff if Utd don't want me
content: Ruben Amorim has said he will not seek compensation from Manchester United if they decide he is not the right man for the job after the Europa League final defeat to Tottenham Hotspur.

title: 'Serial winner' Ange unsure on future: 'Que será'
content: BILBAO, Spain -- Tottenham Hotspur boss Ange Postecoglou has insisted he is unaware of any meetings about his future at the club, but said "whatever happens, happens" after ending Spurs' 17-year wait for a trophy.

title: Son ends Spurs drought: 'Let's say I'm a legend'
content: Captain Son Heung-Min accepted the tag of Spurs legend after lifting the club's first trophy in 17 years following a victory in Wednesday's Europa League final.

title: Sources: Endrick out of CWC, Bellingham set for op
content: Real Madrid forward Endrick will be out for two months and miss the Club World Cup with a hamstring injury, sources confirmed to ESPN.

title: NWSL's Boston to play opening season at Gillette
content: Boston Legacy, a 2026 NWSL expansion franchise, will play its first season at Gillette Stadium in Foxborough, Massachusetts, due to delays with the redevelopment of its proposed home stadium.

title: Flick signs new Barcelona deal after LaLiga win
content: Barcelona coach Hansi Flick has extended his contract with the club after guiding them to the LaLiga trophy, signing a new deal until 2027.

title: Sources: USMNT's Cardoso top target for Atlético
content: Johnny Cardoso is Atlético Madrid's top target as they look to strengthen the midfield line in the summer transfer window, sources have told ESPN.

title: All you need to know about the newest season of 'The Ultimate Fighter'
content: Here's everything you need to know about Season 33 of TUF. From how to watch, the coaches involved and the fighters competing for a UFC contract.

title: Olympic-style event in 2026 to feature PED use
content: A new company hoping to infuse PEDs into Olympic-style sports says it will hold its first formal competition next May.

title: Why the NBA's 26 eliminated teams should watch these conference finals
content: As four teams battle for the title, 26 teams are looking to improve -- and watching the conference finals can help.

title: NBA playoff futures: Knicks favored in East; OKC is Finals favorite
content: With the conference finals underway, here are the updated odds to win the NBA championship and Finals MVP.

title: Stanley Cup playoff odds: Panthers slight East favorites
content: Every playoff team's odds to win the 2025 Stanley Cup and favorites for the Conn Smythe Trophy for playoff MVP.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Arsenal make first move for €80m Real Madrid star Rodrygo
content: Arsenal have held the first exploratory discussions to sign Rodrygo from Real Madrid. Transfer Talk has the latest news, gossip and rumors.

title: "Relations Built On Sensitivities To...": India On Turkey's Support To Pak
content: In a strong message to Turkey over its support to Pakistan in recent times, the Government of India said on Thursday that New Delhi expects Ankara to encourage Pakistan to address the problem of cross-border terrorism emanating from it.

title: In Pics: All You Need To Know About US' Minuteman III Missile
content: The US Air Force launched a nuclear-capable intercontinental ballistic missile (ICBM), Minuteman III, in a doomsday missile test on Wednesday.

title: Sheena Bora Case: CBI Drops 65 Witnesses, Including Peter Mukerjea's Ex-Wife
content: The Central Bureau of Investigation on Thursday submitted before a special court 65 names they have dropped from the list of witnesses to be examined in the Sheena Bora murder case, including Peter Mukherjea's former wife Shabnam Singh.

title: UK Court Lifts Injunction Allowing Chagos Islands Deal To Proceed
content: Britain can conclude a deal with Mauritius on the future of the Chagos Islands on Thursday after a judge at London's High Court overturned an eleventh-hour injunction which had blocked the agreement being signed earlier.

title: Blog: Blog | A Decade Later, Why Piku Still Hurts
content: The tragedy of Piku is that in the effort to raise a feminist daughter, Bhashkor inadvertently created a woman who cannot separate agency from obligation. She has the freedom to walk away, but no inner permission to exercise it.

title: Security Scare At Salman Khan's Mumbai House, Man And Woman Arrested
content: A man and a woman were arrested by the Mumbai Police for allegedly attempting to enter Bollywood actor Salman Khan's residence this week, police said on Thursday.

title: Soldier Killed In Action During Encounter With Terrorists In J&K's Kishtwar
content: A soldier has been killed in action in an encounter with terrorists in Jammu and Kashmir's Kishtwar, which broke out early on Thursday.

title: Kolkata 12-Year-Old Who Battled Kidney Failure Gifts Life To 1, Vision To 2
content: Having battled renal failure for over a year, 12-year-old Umang Galada from Kolkata finally got a kidney transplant earlier this month, but suffered a cardiac arrest hours after the surgery, which led to brain death.

title: India Working On US Reciprocal Tariff Exemption, Interim Deal By July 8
content: India and the US are trying to negotiate an interim deal before July 8 to ensure full exemption from the imposition of 26 per cent "reciprocal tariff" on Indian domestic goods, government sources have said.

title: In Pics: The Air Defence System That Gave India Edge During Op Sindoor
content: India's Air Defence Systems proved their prowess at the height of the tensions with Pakistan during 'Operation Sindoor'.

title: Trump Ambushed South Africa's Ramaphosa With Video. It Had Many Falsehoods
content: US President Donald Trump ambushed his South African counterpart Cyril Ramaphosa at talks Wednesday with a video meant to support unfounded claims of the "persecution" of white farmers.

title: Blog: Blog | Gaza: What To Think About When You're Too Tired To Think About War
content: Amid the fire and fury, a quieter story is also unfolding, however invisible it may be: Israelis and Palestinians, Jewish and Arab citizens within Israel, and a few cases in the occupied West Bank, working to build a shared and peaceful society.

title: France Denies Telegram Founder Pavel Durov's Request To Visit US
content: France has denied a request by Telegram founder Pavel Durov to travel to the United States for talks with investment funds, prosecutors said Thursday.

title: BJP MLA N Munirathna Charged Over Gangrape Of Party Worker
content: Karnataka Police has registered an FIR against BJP MLA N. Munirathna, who represents the RR Nagar Assembly constituency in Bengaluru, on the charges of orchestrating the gangrape of a party worker.

title: PM Modi Inaugurates Redeveloped Amrit Bharat Deshnoke Railway Station In Rajasthan
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi inaugurated the redeveloped Amrit Bharat Deshnoke Railway Station and flagged off the Bikaner-Mumbai train service in Rajasthan's Bikaner district on Thursday.

title: "Responsible And Proper": Japanese Strategic Expert On Operation Sindoor
content: Japanese strategic expert Satoru Nagao, a Fellow (Non-resident) at the Hudson Institute, has praised India's Operation Sindoor, calling it a "responsible and proper" response against state-sponsored terrorism.

title: Trump's 'Golden Dome' Defence Plan May Launch New Era Of Space Weapons
content: US President Donald Trump's Golden Dome missile defense concept revives a controversial, decades-old initiative whose ambitious construction could upend norms in outer space and reshape relations between the world's top space powers.

title: All About Mohammed Sinwar, Hamas Leader "Probably" Killed By Israel
content: Israel has "probably" killed Mohammed Sinwar, de facto leader of Hamas in Gaza, Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu said on Wednesday.

title: Supreme Court's 'Chance vs Merit' Order Against NEET-PG Seat-Blocking
content: Blocking of seats during counselling for postgraduate medical courses disadvantages higher-ranked candidates and undermines merit-based selection, the Supreme Court said today

title: 'Ties are built ...': India's strong message to Turkey, China for backing Pak
content: India anticipates that Turkey and China will press Pakistan to cease its backing of cross-border terrorism, especially after the Pahalgam attack raised concerns about Turkey's ties with Islamabad. NSA Ajit Doval conveyed India's firm stance against terrorism originating from Pakistan to Chinese Foreign Minister Wang Yi in May.

title: EAM Jaishankar exposes Pak army chief's hand in Pahalgam attack
content: External affairs minister S Jaishankar highlighted the Pakistan army chief's religious views as a factor in the Pahalgam attack, where terrorists killed 26 civilians after identifying their religion. He asserted India's claim over Pakistan-occupied Kashmir, demanding its return. While Jaishankar acknowledged that several countries, including the United States, reached out during the crisis, he also made it clear that the ceasefire resolution was entirely bilateral, not mediated by any third party.

title: Soldier killed during encounter with terrorists in J&K's Kishtwar
content: A soldier died in a gunfight with terrorists in Kishtwar, Jammu and Kashmir. The operation, named 'Op Trashi,' is ongoing in Chhatru. Joint forces initiated it after intelligence about 3-4 Jaish-e-Mohammad terrorists. Operations intensified after the Pahalgam attack on tourists. India responded with strikes in Pakistan-occupied Jammu & Kashmir but paused after Pakistan requested a ceasefire. Security operations continue.

title: Indian-American who 'shamed' Microsoft CEOs at 50th anniversary celebrations, disrupts event again
content: Indian-American engineer Vaniya Agrawal, previously known for disrupting Microsoft's 50th anniversary, recently protested at the Build 2025 developer event. Agrawal, along with ex-Microsoft employee Hossam Nasr, confronted Microsoft's AI security head, Neta Haiby, over the company's contracts with Israel.

title: 'Not blood, but sindoor flows in my veins': PM Modi's fierce message to Pak
content: In a fiery address in Bikaner, Prime Minister Modi declared India's firm stance against Pakistan following the Pahalgam terror attack. He asserted that India retaliated by destroying nine terror hideouts in Pakistan within 22 minutes. Modi emphasized that India will respond strongly to any attacks, with the armed forces determining the time and manner.

title: CBI files chargesheet against ex-J&K guv in corruption case
content: The CBI has filed a chargesheet against former J&K Governor Satya Pal Malik and five others in the Kiru hydropower corruption case. This follows a 2022 request from the J&K government for a CBI inquiry into irregularities in awarding civil contracts worth ₹2,200 crore for the Kiru Hydro Electric Power Project.

title: EAM counters Trump, reveals what led to India-Pak ceasefire
content: External affairs minister S Jaishankar refuted Donald Trump's claim of brokering peace between India and Pakistan. Jaishankar clarified that the cessation of hostilities occurred through direct communication after Pakistan signaled its readiness to stop firing on May 10. This followed India's 'Operation Sindoor' targeting terror sites in response to the Pahalgam attack.

title: Tesla Bull Ross Gerber dumps his Tesla stock, predicts total collapse
content: Ross Gerber, a prominent Tesla bull, has sold a significant portion of his Tesla shares, citing concerns about the company's future. This decision followed a substantial drop in Tesla's stock value after Elon Musk's controversial actions.

title: Shivakumar’s ‘wedding gift’ spin as ED targets HM Parameshwara over Ranya Rao case
content: Enforcement Directorate's searches at institutions linked to Karnataka Home Minister G Parameshwara triggered a strong defense from Deputy CM D K Shivakumar, who vouched for Parameshwara's integrity amidst money laundering probe connected to a gold smuggling racket. Shivakumar downplayed allegations of Parameshwara gifting actress Ranya Rao, whose accounts are under scrutiny, asserting his colleague's honesty and commitment to the law.

title: Govt reserves 4% central housing for persons with disabilities
content: The central government has announced a 4% reservation in central government housing for Divyangjans, reflecting a commitment to empowerment and an inclusive India. This initiative aligns with the Rights of Persons with Disabilities Act, 2016, and the Sugamya Bharat Abhiyan, aiming to ensure fair access and promote universal accessibility for people with disabilities in all aspects of life.

title: Barry Diller on Elon Musk: ‘If people saw him in box today, they will throw…’
content: Barry Diller observed a swift shift in public sentiment towards Elon Musk, contrasting the enthusiastic reception Musk received at the 2024 US Open with a hypothetical scenario of public disapproval months later. Musk's growing ties to Donald Trump and right-wing politics have sparked backlash, impacting Tesla's stock and leading to calls for boycotts.

title: 'Bharat very different now': VP Dhankhar hails Operation Sindoor
content: Vice President Jagdeep Dhankhar on Thursday lauded Operation Sindoor, emphasizing Prime Minister Modi's firm message to challenging neighbors and the global community that terrorism will face consequences. Speaking at Goa Raj Bhavan, he highlighted India's confident stance and the international recognition of its armed forces' capabilities during the strategic operation.

title: Man and woman try to enter Salman Khan’s home in Bandra, detained
content: A 23-year-old man from Chhattisgarh was detained by Mumbai Police for attempting to enter Salman Khan's residence, Galaxy Apartments, in Bandra. The man initially arrived at the gate, claiming to be a fan wanting to meet the actor, and later returned, blocking a resident's car to gain access.

title: When Anupam Mittal slammed 'haan haan samajh gaya' culture
content: Anupam Mittal, Shark Tank judge, recently addressed workplace miscommunication on LinkedIn. He noticed Indian employees hesitate to seek clarity due to fear of embarrassment. Mittal contrasts this with US culture, where asking questions is encouraged. He suggests strategies like asking employees to repeat instructions and observing body language. Mittal emphasizes that effective communication means being understood well.

title: 'Justice must be served': India condemns killing of Israeli diplomats
content: External affairs minister S Jaishankar condemned the killing of Israeli diplomats in Washington, demanding justice for the perpetrators. The suspect, Elias Rodriguez, allegedly shot two embassy staff members near the Capital Jewish Museum, chanting "Free Palestine" during his arrest. President Trump denounced the killings as antisemitic, emphasizing that hatred and radicalism have no place in the USA.

title: Bomb threat causes panic at Punjab and Haryana high court; premises evacuated
content: A bomb threat at the Punjab and Haryana High Court in Chandigarh prompted a swift response from law enforcement on Thursday. The Quick Reaction Team and bomb disposal squad evacuated the building, while the High Court Bar Association alerted its members.

title: This Indian-origin Tesla CFO earns more than Pichai, Nadella!
content: Vaibhav Taneja, Tesla's CFO, received a substantial $139 million compensation in 2024, surpassing the pay of tech giants like Satya Nadella and Sundar Pichai. This compensation primarily consists of stock options and equity linked to performance metrics, with a relatively small portion as direct salary.

title: What is Amrit Bharat station scheme? PM inaugurates 103 redeveloped railway stations
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi is set to inaugurate the redeveloped Deshnoke railway station in Bikaner, Rajasthan, along with 102 other stations upgraded under the Amrit Bharat Station Scheme. This nationwide project aims to modernize railway infrastructure, focusing on enhanced passenger comfort, cleanliness, and connectivity.

title: 750 pilgrims selected for Kailash Mansarovar yatra in June 2025
content: After a five-year hiatus, the Kailash Mansarovar Yatra is set to resume in June 2025, with 750 pilgrims selected via a computerized lottery. Pilgrims will journey through Lipulekh and Nathu La routes. The pilgrimage, suspended due to COVID-19 and border tensions, is viewed as a step towards mending India-China relations.

title: 12-year-old dalit girl gang-raped, filmed by 5 schoolboys in principal's office in UP
content: In a shocking incident in Moradabad, five schoolboys, aged 12 to 15, allegedly gang-raped a 12-year-old Dalit girl inside a school principal's office after drugging her. The assault, filmed by the perpetrators, was circulated online, prompting the girl's mother to file a police report.

title: Kerala DHSE +2 Result: Websites to check results safely
content: The DHSE Kerala Plus Two Result 2025 is being declared today, May 22, at 3 PM. With over 4.44 lakh students awaiting their marks, the article guides students on checking results through official websites and warns against using unofficial portals. It explains the risks of fake websites, lists safe platforms like keralaresults.nic.in and DigiLocker, and provides a step-by-step guide to access results. Students are advised to prioritise accuracy and data safety during this crucial time.

title: Banu Mushtaq's fight for Muslim women's rights wins International Booker
content: Banu Mushtaq, a writer and activist from Karnataka, has gained global recognition for her powerful storytelling centered on resistance, gender justice, and social reform. As a prominent voice in the Bandaya Sahitya movement, she challenged patriarchal structures and advocated for women's rights within the Muslim community, including the right to offer namaz in mosques.

title: 'No talks, no trade, discussion only on PoK': PM Modi's stern warning to Pakistan
content: Prime Minister Modi, addressing a rally in Rajasthan, asserted India's firm stance on national security and counterterrorism, highlighting the recent Operation Sindoor where armed forces destroyed terrorist bases within 22 minutes. He ruled out dialogue and trade with Pakistan, focusing solely on reclaiming Pakistan-occupied Kashmir. Modi warned against continued terror exports, threatening to block water flow and dismissing nuclear threats.

title: Haryana YouTuber Jyoti Malhotra sent to 4-day police remand amid espionage charges
content: Jyoti Malhotra, a YouTuber from Haryana, faces police custody. She is accused of sharing sensitive details with a Pakistani national. The individual is allegedly linked to Pakistani intelligence. Hisar police are investigating her financial transactions and digital communications. Authorities deny rumors of her conversion to Islam or marriage to a Pakistani operative.

title: 'Crossing all limits': Supreme Court raps ED over Tasmac raids, issues notice
content: The Supreme Court criticized the Enforcement Directorate regarding Tasmac raids. The court stated that the ED is exceeding its boundaries. It stayed proceedings after the ED raid on the state-run liquor retailer. The court questioned the ED's authority to raid Tasmac, citing federal principles. The ED has been given two weeks to respond. The case involves alleged financial misconduct.

title: Nifty50 below 24,550; Sensex drops over 1,000 points: Top reasons market is falling
content: Stock market today: Indian equity benchmark indices, Nifty50 and BSE Sensex, tanked in trade on Thursday. While Nifty50 went below 24,550, BSE Sensex was down over 1,100 points intraday.

title: BTech graduate to Maoist: Fall of Basavaraj a turning point in India’s Maoist insurgency
content: Nambala Keshava Rao, alias Basavaraj, the general secretary of the CPI (Maoist), was killed in an encounter in Chhattisgarh, marking a significant blow to the Maoist insurgency in India. Basavaraj, a former engineering graduate, rose through the ranks to become a key military strategist, orchestrating major attacks and maintaining international connections.

title: India U-19 tour of England: Mhatre to lead, Sooryavanshi named in squad
content: Ayush Mhatre, a 17-year-old Mumbai opener, has been appointed as the captain of the India U-19 team for their upcoming tour of England, which includes a series of one-day and multi-day matches.

title: ‘Karara jawaab milega’: PM Modi's 3 anti-terror principles post Op Sindoor
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi, in his first public address since Operation Sindoor in Bikaner, articulated a robust three-point doctrine guiding India's counter-terrorism strategy. He asserted that any terrorist attack would be met with a decisive response, determined by Indian forces. Modi dismissed nuclear threats and emphasised holding states accountable for supporting terrorism, ending the distinction between state and non-state actors.

title: 'Free Palestine': Suspect screams after gunning down 2 Israeli embassy staffers
content: In Washington DC, a suspect shot and killed two staff members of the Israeli Embassy near a Jewish museum. The suspect, while in custody, repeatedly chanted "Free Palestine." Police detained the individual after he was seen pacing outside the museum.

title: 5,000-yr-old wine jars discovered to reveal science of ancient wine making
content: Archaeologists in Egypt unearthed 5,000-year-old wine jars, many sealed, in Queen Meret-Neith's tomb at Abydos. This find provides direct evidence of early winemaking, offering insights into ancient Egyptian production, preservation, and usage of wine. Chemical analysis and grape seeds could reshape our understanding of ancient viticulture and its cultural significance.

title: 'Ended extremely poorly': Parth Jindal apologises to Delhi Capitals fans
content: Delhi Capitals co-owner Parth Jindal apologised to fans after their IPL 2025 playoff hopes were crushed by a 59-run defeat to Mumbai Indians. Jindal expressed disappointment on social media, acknowledging a poor second half of the season. Delhi, surprisingly, became the first IPL team to miss the playoffs after winning their initial four matches.

title: Banu Mushtaq: Story born under banyan tree in my village can cast shadow across world
content: Kannada author Banu Mushtaq made history by winning the International Booker Prize for her short-story collection, 'Heart Lamp.' Translated by Deepa Bhasthi, it's the first anthology to receive this honor. Mushtaq, a voice of resistance and Bandaya Sahitya movement participant, sees the award as recognition for Kannada literature and its universal stories.

title: Floating garbage: Rain reduces Mumbai to sea of trash - watch viral video
content: Mumbai experienced over 60 mm of rainfall in the last 24 hours, causing significant disruption. A viral video showed garbage-filled, waterlogged streets in areas like SakiNaka, sparking outrage over waste management. Social media users criticized authorities for inadequate drainage. The IMD forecasts continued rains, with high and low tides expected. Moderate rainfall was recorded across the city and suburbs.

title: IPL playoffs history: MI pip RCB, inch closer to CSK's record
content: Mumbai Indians secured the final playoff spot in IPL 2025 after a dominant victory over Delhi Capitals, joining Gujarat Titans, Royal Challengers Bengaluru, and Punjab Kings. The playoffs will commence at the New PCA Stadium in New Chandigarh with Qualifier 1 and the Eliminator.

title: RJD poster labels Tejashwi as ‘shudh desi Bihari’, brands Chirag Paswan an outsider
content: A poster war has erupted in Patna, sparked by an RJD functionary's proclamation of Tejashwi Yadav as the "real Bihari," while branding Chirag Paswan as an outsider. This comes after a cordial meeting between Tejashwi and Chirag.

title: Chai pe charcha goes global: India marks 'International Tea Day' at UN
content: India's UN mission hosted an International Tea Day event, emphasising tea's role in economic empowerment and sustainable development. Ambassador Harish highlighted the industry's support for millions of livelihoods, particularly for women in rural India. Discussions addressed challenges like climate change impacting small-scale farmers, with calls for innovation and climate-smart practices to ensure the industry's future.

title: Foxconn readies iPhone campus in India with dorms for 30,000 staff
content: Foxconn is constructing a 300-acre campus in India, including dormitories for 30,000 workers. Despite Donald Trump's suggestion to avoid building in India, Apple plans to manufacture most iPhones for the US market there. The facility in Devanahalli, Karnataka, represents a $2.56 billion investment, with production targets set for 100,000 iPhones by December.

title: UPSC CSE prelims 2025 answer key released for GS Paper 1 and 2
content: The Union Public Service Commission (UPSC) has released the official answer keys for the Civil Services Examination (CSE) 2024 prelims. Candidates can now download the keys for General Studies Papers 1 and 2 from the UPSC websites. Notably, three questions were dropped from Paper 1. The results and interview rounds have already been completed.

title: How can Mumbai Indians top IPL 2025 Points Table? All scenarios explained
content: Mumbai Indians secured their playoff spot in IPL 2025 with a dominant victory over Delhi Capitals, setting the stage for a thrilling finish. To clinch a top-two position, MI must defeat Punjab Kings and hope for multiple losses from Gujarat Titans, Royal Challengers Bengaluru, and Punjab Kings in their remaining matches.

title: '8th time Trump made this claim': Cong questions PM Modi's 'silence' on India-Pak
content: Congress leader Pawan Khera has criticized Prime Minister Modi's silence regarding President Trump's repeated claims of brokering peace between India and Pakistan. Trump asserted he used trade negotiations to halt 'Operation Sindoor,' a claim India refutes.

title: Who is Elias Rodriguez? Suspect in killing two Israeli embassy staffers in Washington
content: In Washington, DC, a tragic shooting occurred outside the Jewish Museum, resulting in the deaths of two Israeli embassy staff members. Elias Rodriguez, a 30-year-old from Chicago, was apprehended after the incident, during which he chanted "Free, free Palestine." Authorities are investigating the motives behind the attack, with President Trump condemning it as antisemitic.

title: Updated SP+ rankings for every FBS team, plus an early look at CFP contenders
content: the 2025 college football season starts again in 93 days . teams have averaged more than 19 transfers this offseason, up more than 40% from last season . the returning production numbers are based on rosters I have updated as much as humanly possible .

title: Which teams are the most QB-needy for 2026? Here are 11 teams that are in the market
content: the bulk of the 2026 recruiting class will sort itself over the next three months . 43% of ESPN's top 300 prospects sealed their final commitments between June 1 and Aug. 31 . all four of the nation's five-star QBs and 14 of the 18 passers ranked inside 2026 ESPN 300 are committed .

title: The Wolves' offensive evolution is stalling in the West finals
content: the Minnesota Timberwolves lost to the Utah Jazz in game 1 of the Western Conference finals . the Timberwolves went 17-4, rising out of the play-in morass to the no. 6 seed . they beat the los Angeles lakers and Golden State Warriors in five games apiece .

title: Can the Hurricanes score enough goals to win the Stanley Cup?
content: the Carolina Hurricanes beat the skeptics 5-2 in the Eastern Conference finals . winger Andrei Svechnikov swears they have enough offense to reach the Stanley Cup final . the team was limited to one goal in game 1 of the finals against the Florida Panthers until Jackson Blake added a garbage-time power play marker .

title: Stars rally in Game 1: Grades for both teams, players to watch for Game 2
content: the Oilers scored five straight goals in game 1 of the Western Conference finals . it was like a defibrillator for the Stars, who barely had a pulse after going down 3-1 after two periods . the oilers won game 1 by a 6-3 score .

title: Inside Shai Gilgeous-Alexander's improbable two-decade rise
content: the Suns were tied for sixth, just a game out of the play-in tournament . the Thunder had become the no. 1 seed in the Western Conference . Durant, a former MVP and two-time champion, answered with a 3 .

title: 16 must-watch stars, 8 must-watch matchups: Top players in the 2025 college softball super regionals
content: the 2025 NCAA softball super regionals is set for the women's college world series in Oklahoma City, Oklahoma . no. 2-seed Oklahoma will host a no. 15-seed Alabama team that looks to spoil the Sooners' five-peat quest with its talented roster . here are the must-watch players on every remaining team .

title: 'Direct hit to homes': Small plane crashes into residential area in San Diego
content: seasoned journalists and passionate writers tirelessly sift through the vast tapestry of global events to bring you the latest news and diverse perspectives round the clock . toi World Desk is a dedicated team of journalists and writers who work tirelessly to keep you informed about the ever-evolving world .

title: Citizens urged to avail themselves of benefits of Yashasvini Health Insurance Scheme
content: Aland MLA B.R. Patil addresses event to distribute Yashasvini Health Card organised at KMF Salasar Kalyan Mantap in Kalaburagi

title: NEET-PG: Supreme Court mandates pre-counselling fee disclosure by universities
content: The Bench further ordered authorities to enforce strict penalties for seat blocking including forfeiture of security deposit, disqualification from future NEET-PG exams and blacklisting complicit colleges

title: TASMAC FIRs shall not be closed for now, AG assures Madras High Court
content: Makes the submission before a Division Bench seized of a PIL plea to transfer all FIRs from DVAC to CBI

title: India-Pakistan understanding on cessation of hostilities reached bilaterally: Jaishankar
content: The cessation of firing and military action was something which was negotiated directly between India and Pakistan, says EAM S. Jaishankar

title: Death toll in Sengipatti road accident rises to six
content: All the victims were travelling by a van to Velankanni from Bengaluru when the accident occurred at Sengipatti on Nagapattinam-Tiruchi Highway in Thanjavur district on Wednesday night

title: Month after massacre of tourists, Pahalgam locals count livelihood losses
content: Pahalgam had not worn such a deserted look even at the peak of the early 1990s' insurgency, said tour operator Nasir Ahmad

title: Mysuru–Kushalnagar highway project finally on track after long delays
content: The new highway is anticipated to substantially reduce travel time between Bengaluru and Kushalnagar, which in turn will benefit travellers heading further west to Madikeri and Mangaluru.

title: UAE reaffirms its unwavering support for India in global fight against terrorism
content: Terrorism is an enemy of humanity. Wise people should rise and speak against it, says Ali Rashid Al Nuaimi, Chairman of the Defence Affairs, Interior & Foreign Affairs Committee

title: CoBRA commando, Maoist killed in Chhattisgarh operation
content: The operation is being led by the 210th battalion of CRPF's CoBRA and has troops from Chhattisgarh Police DRG and STF

title: ASI asks archaeologist Amarnath Ramakrishna to rewrite his report on Keezhadi excavations
content: A letter from the ASI said two experts had suggested corrections in the report submitted by Mr. Ramakrishna, who was in charge of the excavation, to make it “more authentic.”

title: Average mandi prices of major food crops ruling below MSP: RBI article
content: Mandi prices of major food crops are below MSP due to a bumper harvest, with easing prices and a positive outlook for food security

title: Punjab and Haryana High Court receives bomb threat mail; police launch search
content: "An e-mail was sent to the registrar's office of the High Court, claiming that an IED had been planted in the complex. On being informed, police launched a thorough search," Chandigarh Police official said

title: Supreme Court directs NHAI to take effective steps to curb unauthorised occupation of highways
content: The Supreme Court also directed the Centre to give wide publicity to the availability of ‘Rajmargyatra’ mobile application on print, electronic, as well as social media

title: NH-66 collapse in Kerala: Centre debars construction and consultancy firms involved
content: Centre also brings two company officials under the ambit of its ongoing inquiry into collapse of highway stretch

title: T.N. police attempting to cover up Arakkonam sexual harassment case, alleges BJP’s L. Murugan
content: Mr. Murugan said: “In both the Anna University sexual assault case and the Arakkonam case, DMK functionaries were involved”

title: Tamil Nadu Sand Lorry Owners Association’s proposed indefinite strike withdrawn
content: The proposed strike was withdrawn after Minister for Natural Resources S. Regupathy assured the association that he would take up their issues with CM Stalin

title: Telangana Deputy CM seeks cooperation of banks to achieve Rajiv Yuva Vikasam targets
content: Govt earmarked ₹6,250 crore for the scheme, to distribute sanction letters to five lakh youth on June 2

title: Fresh COVID-19 case detected in Odisha after two-and-a-half years, patient stable
content: "The situation is completely under control and there is no need to worry," says Health and Family Welfare Secretary S. Aswathy

title: ‘Sindoor turned into barood’: PM Modi’s message to Pakistan in Rajasthan’s Bikaner
content: In a strong message to Pakistan, Mr. Modi said that if India faces a terrorist attack, a strong retaliation will follow

title: At 27, YouTuber MrBeast Is The Only Self-Made Billionaire Under 30
content: MrBeast is the eighth youngest billionaire worldwide with an estimated $1 billion (Rs 8,350 crore) fortune . he began his YouTube journey at 12 under the username "MrBeast6000" he created other viral stunts like counting to 100,000, reading the entire dictionary, and watching a music video on repeat .

title: Namma Metro to operate on normal schedule on May 23 as IPL match moved from Bengaluru to Lucknow
content: This change comes in the wake of the Board of Control for Cricket in India (BCCI) shifting the scheduled Indian Premier League (IPL) match, originally set to be held in Bengaluru, to Lucknow

title: Punjab CM Mann opposes Centre's move to deploy CISF personnel at Nangal dam
content: Addressing the media in Sangrur on Thursday, Mr. Mann said the deployment of CISF personnel will cost ₹8.58 crore per annum, showing a copy of the Centre's letter in this regard

title: Odisha CM asks officials to include widowed women under 'Mukhya Mantri Kanya Vivah Yojana'
content: CM Mohan Majhi said the scheme aims to financially support the poor, helpless and economically weak families for the marriage of their daughters

title: Why did Madras High Court stay laws taking away T.N. Governor’s power to appoint Vice-Chancellors? | Explained
content: What is the reasoning given by the Division Bench for staying the amended laws? Can UGC Regulations prevail over State Acts? Do courts have power to stay the operation of Acts? Can a summer vacation bench pass such orders? Does the High Court order amount to reviewing Supreme Court’s verdict in Governor’s assent case?

title: NCP expels party leader, his son named in dowry harassment-suicide case
content: NCP expels Rajendra Hagawne and his son Susheel Hagawne from the party, days after the political controversy surrounding the alleged dowry death of Mr Rajendra’s daughter-in-law Vaishali Hagawne.

title: Two collection boxes gutted in Belagavi toll plaza fire
content: A petrol tanker caught fire a it was moving through the plaza lane, which then spreas to the two toll boxes, police officers said.

title: Watch: Why some States are upset with the Centre over revenue sharing: Part 1
content: In the first part of this three-part series, The Hindu Data Team simplifies the complexities of fiscal federalism using a ₹100 note to illustrate how funds are shared

title: TASMAC raids: Supreme Court says ED crossing all limits, breaching federal structure
content: The DMK-run state government and TASMAC moved the top court against the raids conducted by the ED at the premises of TASMAC.

title: Chhattisgarh: DRG jawan killed in IED blast while returning from Abhujmad encounter
content: The incident took place in densely forested Abhujmad area when security personnel were returning after a major encounter with Maoists

title: Jyoti Rani’s police custody extended by four days; vlogger didn’t have access to secret information, says Police
content: In a press statement on May 22, the Hisar police maintained there was no direct evidence to suggest that she was in touch with any terrorist organisation.

title: PM Modi in Rajasthan, inaugurates redeveloped 103 railway stations under Amrit Bharat scheme
content: Under the scheme, 1,337 railway stations are being renovated and modernised. Of these Amirt stations, 103 were virtually inaugurated by PM Modi in Rajasthan

title: Owaisi slams Centre over Waqf legislation, calls it blow to federalism
content: You and I must remain united. We must abide by the programmes of the AIMPLB. Our protest will continue. This law must be withdrawn: AIMIM chief Owaisi

title: Indian ‘chai’ at special event hosted by India at U.N. to mark International Tea Day
content: The Permanent Mission of India to the U.N. hosted a high-level event on May 21, 2025, on the theme ‘Tea for Livelihoods, Tea for SDGs’ to mark the International Tea Day

title: Delhi–Srinagar IndiGo flight turbulence: 'Near death experience,' says TMC leader Sagarika Ghose
content: "Hats off to the pilot who brought us through that. When we landed we saw the nose of the plane had blown up," she said; the aircraft with 200 people onboard landed safely in Srinagar.

title: Haryana YouTuber had been in touch with Pakistani staffer since 2023: Police
content: Jyoti Malhotra had been in touch with Ehsan-ur-Rahim alias Danish, the Pakistani staffer at the Pakistani High Commission, since November 2023, a source said

title: Kerala govt can resolve Munambam issue by acquiring land: Judicial Commission
content: Justice (retired) C.N. Ramachandran Nair says Kerala government has powers to protect Munambam residents within provisions of existing law

title: PM Modi has not rejected Trump's 'India-Pakistan ceasefire' claims even once: Congress senior leader Pawan Khera
content: Congress' media and publicity department head Pawan Khera said this is the eighth time President Trump has made this claim that he got Operation Sindoor stopped

title: Fitch raises India's average growth potential to 6.4% till 2028
content: ‘The Indian economy bounced back more strongly than we expected at the time of the 2023 report, suggesting a less adverse “scarring” impact from the pandemic shock,’ Fitch said while updating the five-year-ahead potential GDP projections.

title: Can IREDA pursue remedies against Gensol parallelly under IBC and DRT?
content: “It is legally permissible for a financial creditor like IREDA to initiate parallel proceedings under both the DRT framework and the Insolvency and Bankruptcy Code (IBC) provided the objectives are distinct and not barred by law”, Akshat Khetan, Founder, AU Corporate Advisory and Legal Services said.

title: Man arrested in Kota for molesting minor girl by scaring her with ‘pet’ cobra
content: The complainant also accused Imran of keeping a cobra in his room to frighten women and girls before molesting them and to cheat people.

title: T.N. Finance Minister Thangam Thennarasu urges RBI to withdraw new restrictions on gold loans
content: Mr. Thennarasu said reducing the loan-to-value ratio to 75% and burdening borrowers with excessive documentation gravely affects poor and middle-class families who depend on such loans during emergencies

title: Police trace two missing children in Kerala’s Kozhikode
content: Search on for one more minor boy who escaped with the other two from Government Children’s Home on Thursday evening

title: Pakistan expels Indian High Commission staffer
content: India expelled a Pakistani official working at the Pakistan High Commission on May 21 on charges of involvement in espionage

title: Maharashtra launches Mahavistar App ahead of Kharif Season
content: As the Indian Meteorological Department (IMD) has forecasted heavy rainfall across Maharashtra, Mr. Fadnavis has instructed officials to ensure that farmers receive seeds and fertiliser on time

title: Kishtwar encounter: One soldier dead, operation continuing, says Army
content: The Army launched a major anti-terror operation in forest area of Singhpora Chatroo in Kishtwar district, following a tip-off

title: Waqf (Amendment) Act hearing highlights: Supreme Court reserves verdict on plea for stay
content: Solicitor General Tushar Mehta earlier argued that waqf, though an Islamic concept, is not an essential religious practice and that waqf boards perform secular functions

title: Water-sharing dispute: Punjab holds ‘victory rally’
content: Punjab CM Mann says Punjabis  didn’t allow Haryana and the Centre to take away even a single drop of water

title: BJP MLA  Kanwar Lal Meena surrenders in Rajasthan court after a 3-year sentence in 2005 case
content: Supreme Court recently upheld his three-year rigorous imprisonment for ‘pointing a pistol at a Sub-Divisional Magistrate during an election’; no decision yet on his disqualification from House

title: Murshidabad violence:  BJP Trinamool spar over fact finding report
content: The report by the three member committee had highlighted the presence of local Trinamool Congress leaders including local councillor and MLA at the site of violence. The report which was submitted before the division bench of Justice Soumen Sen and Justice Raja Basu Chowdhury also added that the West Bengal Police did not respond to calls by the locals.

title: When ganja seeds begin to sprout in public places
content: The Excise team that reached the spot found that suspicion to be true as they ‘took into custody’ the 63-cm-long plant visible amid shrubs and weeds.

title: Gadkari has promised swift action against those responsible for NH-66 collapse near Kooriyad bridge: IUML leader
content: Speaking to reporters in New Delhi, Mr. Basheer said he had called on Mr Gadkari to apprise him of the grave public concern following the collapse of a significant portion of the NH-66 near the Kooriyad Bridge.

title: Should water be used as a weapon? | Explained
content: What does the Indus Waters Treaty provide for? How has it been able to withstand three major wars between India and Pakistan? How have disputes surrounding India’s hydropower projects been arbitrated? How have other countries dealt with cross-border river disputes?

title: Woman’s body found stuffed in suitcase in Bengaluru
content: Probe revealed that the woman was strangulated to death and her body stuffed in the suitcase, which was thrown from a moving train.

title: Navodayam 2.0: Andhra Pradesh govt. sets September 30 deadline to become ID Liquor-free
content: Excise Principal Secretary Mukesh Kumar Meena lays out comprehensive strategy for intensified enforcement, calling for district-specific plans and visible results

title: Officials told to take measures to achieve 15% growth rate in allied agricultural sectors in A.P.
content: Agriculture Minister Atchannaidu assesses preparedness for kharif season and asks officials to ensure availability of seeds and fertilizers

title: A.P. CM takes part in Gangamma temple jatara in Kuppam, offers silk vastrams to deity
content: Estimated 3 lakh devotees from Kuppam constituency, and neighbouring Tamil Nadu and Karnataka take part in the annual festival

title: Supriya Sule demands judicial inquiry into dowry death allegations against Pune NCP leader
content: The National Commission for Women on May 19 took cognisance of the alleged dowry harassment and death of Vaishnavi Hagawane, daughter-in-law of NCP leader Rajendra Hagawane

title: Confusion over Persian lizard removed after 150 years
content: While Mesalina watsonana has been a key species in the study of desert lizard diversity across South and Central Asia, confusion over its syntypes across museums in Kolkata, London, and Vienna posed a challenge

title: Telephone tapping case: Prabhakar Rao will be proclaimed offender if he fails to appear before court by June 20
content: According to police department, he ‘fled the country’ on learning that the telephone tapping case was registered.

title: Assassinated leaders Farooq and Lone believed dialogue was the best way: Mirwaiz
content: The Mirwaiz paid tributes to his late father and also remembered Khawaja Abdul Ghani Lone Sahab and the “70 innocent mourners who died in the Hawal massacre on the same date.”

title: 17 local bodies get 4.5 acres of govt. land for setting up waste management facilities
content: The land cannot be used for other purposes and local bodies cannot lease, sub-lease, or pledge it with any financial institution. Construction of waste treatment plants and material collection facilities must begin within a year of allotment

title: Miss India among 24 finalists for Miss World 2025 talent competition
content: The finalists were chosen after a series of internal auditions and a competitive rounds held privately at the hotel where the 108 contestants are staying
